      About

      Hello World! I am a postdoc at the University of Georgia’s Center for the Ecology of Infectious Diseases working under supervision of Professor Pejman Rohani. My research is broadly focused on Catastrophic Modeling. Currently I use a combination of mathematical models and machine-learning algorithms for forecasting reemergence of infectious diseases prior to large scale outbreaks. I got my PhD in Engineering from University of Georgia’s College of Engineering in 2017. During my PhD, I became interested in machine learning and began to study it intensively on my own.

      Select Projects

      Implementation of word2vec

      Hierarchical Clustering of Odum School of Ecology Faculty based on their publications

      Neural-network based dependency parser

      Odum School of Ecology Coauthorship Graph

      Attention-based neural machine translation

      Sub-word modeling and convolutional networks

      Arash Saeidpour, Mi Geum Chorzepa, Jason Christian, Stephan Durham
      Engineering Structures, 182, 2019

      Hurricane Vulnerability Of Coastal Bridges Using Multiple Environmental Parameters

      Arash Saeidpour, Mi Geum Chorzepa, Jason Christian, Stephan Durham
      Proc. 10th International Conference on Risk Analysis and Hazard Mitigation, Crete, Greece.

      The shear buckling and postbuckling behavior of laterally pressured curved panels

      MM Alinia, Arash Saeidpour, Mojdeh Amani
      engrXiv, 2019

      Arash Saeidpour, Mojdeh Amani, MM Alinia

      Arash Saeidpour

      Presentations

      - Poster Presentation (2019): “The return’s anatomy: dissection of pertussis resurgence in London”, EEID 2019, Princeton University, Princeton, New Jersey. [Poster]

      - Oral Presentation (2018): “Leveraging census data to unlock insights from changing dynamics of pertussis in London “, Joint MIDAS CDC meeting, Emory University, Atlanta, Georgia.

      - Oral Presentation (2016): “Multi-Hazard Resilient and Sustainable (or MRS) Bridges – Stronger, Taller, Wider,Smarter? “, EMI/PMC 2016, Vanderbilt University, Nashville, Tennessee.

      - Poster Presentation (2016): “Fragility metamodels for vulnerability assessment of coastal bridges under hurricane hazard”, GDOT/GTI 4th Annual Transportation Research Expo, Atlanta, Georgia.

      - Poster Presentation (2015): “Hurricane Risk Assessment for Georgia Coastal Bridges “, GDOT/GTI 3rd Annual Transportation Research Expo, Atlanta, Georgia.
